posts.post_content: You can sac a green, black and red creature as any one of the three required, but not all three. You \*will\* lose three creatures to get Hellkite Overlord out early. Having said that, you can use tokens if you have any out.

posts.post_content: I love this card, I've consistently gotten a Hellkite Overlord on turn three or four in casual play. While I wouldn't win any tournaments with my {B}{R}{G} goblin deck built around this, it sure is fun to play. Dragon's Herald is terrible when considering card advantage, but man, Hellkite Overlord is such an awesome dragon, getting him out is totally worth sacrificing a bunch of little creatures. At least his mana cost isn't excessive, a red 1 drop 1/1 creature with an ability is always great.
posts.html:

Posted By: Templar314 (5/14/2011 1:54:26 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: You get a 1/1 for {R} so it's not bad to start with. Considering Jund has Devour you should have plenty to sacrifice. Off the top of my head there's [Sprouting Thrinax](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sprouting Thrinax) and [Jund Hackblade](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Jund Hackblade) which count for any of the three colors, [Dragon Fodder](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dragon Fodder) tokens, saproling tokens from the Thrinax or [Mycoloth](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mycoloth), and the Dragon's Herald itself. Now think about the fact that it puts an 8/8 flying, trample, haste with regenerate directly onto the battlefield. 3/5.
posts.html:
